Appearance.title: Font sizes (restart for changes to take effect)
Ring elements
Appearance.desc: Font size to use for text on the eypiece ring

Appearance.title: Information panels
Appearance.desc: Font size for corner information panels

Appearance.title: Form elements
Appearance.desc: Font size for form elements eg in DSO entry or session

Appearance.title: Highlight colour
Appearance.desc: Colour used to indicate selected options

Snapshots.title: Dark surround for eyepiece snapshots
Snapshots.desc: If true, surrounding area is black, otherwise white

Snapshots.title: Frame size around image
Snapshots.desc: Adds a margin (in pixels) around landscape image

Snapshots.title: Image size reduction factor for eyepiece view
Snapshots.desc: Reduces image size by this factor (useful on high-density screens)

Confirmation dialogues.title: Confirm when closing Jocular?
Confirmation dialogues.desc: You will be asked to confirm when you hit the quit button

Confirmation dialogues.title: Confirm when clearing stack?
Confirmation dialogues.desc: You will be asked to confirm when clear the stack

Confirmation dialogues.title: Confirm when saving?
Confirmation dialogues.desc: You will be asked to confirm when you hit the save button

Confirmation dialogues.title: Confirm before using estimated exposure?
Confirmation dialogues.desc: If necessary, Jocular will estimate exposure based on arrival times.

Rejected subs.title: Reload rejected/nonaligned subs?
Rejected subs.desc: When loading previous observation, include rejected/nonaligned subs

Exposure estimation.title: Use time of arrival differences
Exposure estimation.desc: Estimate exposure using time of arrival differences in incoming subs

Observatory.title: Latitude
Observatory.desc: In degrees [-90, 90], positive in N hemisphere, negative S of the equator

Observatory.title: Longitude
Observatory.desc: In degrees [-180, 180], positive E of Greenwich, negative W

Watcher.title: Options for FITs in watched directory
Create binned subs from any non-Jocular subs encountered in the watched directory
Watcher.desc: Apply this amount of binning on input. This creates new FITs but the originals are also saved.

Watcher.title: Binning method
Watcher.desc: Average simply averages NxN pixels, whereas interpolation is the more accurate

Watcher.title: Bayer matrix
Watcher.desc: Bayer decoding matrix to apply to none-Jocular subs (set to mono for no debayering)

Watcher.title: Debayer method
Watcher.desc: Bilinear is 2x faster than Malvar2004 and 9x faster than Menon2007

Colour.title: Colour gradients
Colour.desc: Estimate and subtract gradients in each filter

Colour.title: Bin colour channels
Colour.desc: Apply 2x2 software binning to stacked R, G, B filters

View.title: Zoom exponent
View.desc: Value to control mapping from lever position to zoom value; larger values make low power less sensitive (1=linear)

Calibration.title: Exposure
Calibration.desc: How close does exposure have to match to apply calibration frame (in seconds)

Calibration.title: Temperature
Calibration.desc: How close does temperature have to match to apply calibration frame (in degrees C)

Calibration.title: Age
Calibration.desc: Maximum age of darks to use if no temperature specified (in days)

Calibration.title: Use luminosity as backup
Calibration.desc: If no flat available for specific filter, use luminosity flat if available

Calibration.title: Age
Calibration.desc: Maximum age of flats to use (in days)

Alignment.title: Perform alignment
Alignment.desc: Switching off can help diagnose mount issues and the extent of field rotation

Alignment.title: Ideal number of stars for alignment
Alignment.desc: Jocular will find a threshold that delivers this number of stars if possible

Alignment.title: Smooth sub edges
Alignment.desc: Temporary solution to platesolving star extraction artefacts is to switch this on

Hot pixels.title: Apply hot pixel removal
Hot pixels.desc: Automatically remove hot pixels and apply bad pixel mapping

Hot pixels.title: Bad pixel map frames
Hot pixels.desc: Choose how many frames Jocular uses to confirm hot pixels

Plate solving.title: Scope/sensor parameters to compute field of view
Focal length
Plate solving.desc: Approximate focal length (including reducers) in mm

Plate solving.title: Pixel height
Plate solving.desc: Sensor pixel height in micrometers (Lodestar: 8.4, Ultrastar: 6.4)

Plate solving.title: Binning
Plate solving.desc: Expressed as an integer, where 1=no binning

Plate solving.title: Minimum number of matched stars
Plate solving.desc: Must match at least this many stars in stellar database (factory: 10)

Plate solving.title: Return first match?
Plate solving.desc: Stop matching as soon as the minimum number of stars are matched (fastest), or find best match

Plate solving.title: Number of stars to extract
Plate solving.desc: Ideal number of stars to extract from image (factory: 30)

Plate solving.title: Match threshold
Plate solving.desc: How close stars must be to match, in arcsec (factory: 15)

Plate solving.title: Magnitude range
Plate solving.desc: How far down the ranking to go (factory: 5)

Session.title: Hours to retain previous session information
Session.desc: Session information persists for some time to handle restarts of the program

Catalogues.title: Deep catalogues to exclude
Catalogues.desc: List names separated by spaces and without the .npz extension e.g. VS WDS

Filters.title: Filter 1
Filters.desc: Type of filter in position 1 (real or virtual filter wheel!)
